slides.text: 30 years of Cairo: Egyptâ€™s sprawling capital. Satellite-based images are useful in monitoring large scale urban development. The first image was captured by the US Landsat-5 in 1988, the second in 2018 and the third in 2021, both from the Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission.

slides.caption: Cairo and its surroundings on 14 August 1988 from Landsat-5 (USGS/ESA)
Cairo on 2 August 2018 from Copernicus Sentinel-2 (contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2018))
Cairo on 31 August 2021 from Copernicus Sentinel-2 (contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data (2021))
